intro: Guatteria paludosa, commonly known as the swamp guatteria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in wetlands and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important component of tropical understory vegetation.
